pros: Lots of nursing fellowships for experience or new grads. Great place to live.
cons: Housing is too expensive, most live outside of Naples.

job_title: IT Service Desk Analyst in Naples, FL
pros: -Easy Workload -Low stress -Good Managers
cons: -Pay - Sometime have to work holidays

pros: Float Staff Friendly coworkers Hourly
cons: HR doesn’t help in times of need

pros: Student loan repayment program benefits
cons: Short staffing and poor management

pros: I got a ton of experience in many areas because incompetency runs rampant. It's almost like it's part of the hiring experience. "Will you show up every day and not do your job?" If you answer yes, then you are hired. (This is obviously not targeted at clinicians but just those in the administrative and IT departments).
cons: Basically everything. There is no integrity and there is no honesty in almost everyone who I worked with.

review_title: Its a great start but not a lifetime location
pros: Great company, needs better organization in management
cons: High demands, low pay and stress

review_title: Not the best place to work but better than fast food
job_title: Community Health Nurse II in Naples, FL
pros: It’s a stepping stone but not a place to stay. The cost of living in Naples is higher that most places and yet they don’t pay enough to make it affordable. Administration are the only ones that can make a decent salary.
cons:
The pay is not where it should be. They expect you to stay late without asking you. Managers are not willing to stand up against administration to support you. They just keep dumping patients on you, meanwhile they go home a 3 or 4 o’clock and your stuck there waiting to get a bed for a patient until 10 or 11 pm; when your day starts at 6am. 
Human Resources doesn’t have a clue either. It’s like they hired high school kids to work in there. Oh and the benefits are some of the worst I’ve ever had. The health insurance sucks and the hospital doesn’t give a discount to its employees.

review_title: Understaffed and out of control employees
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Naples, FL
pros: None that I personally experienced
cons: Night shift employees run amuck and vanish from the floor. Pay was low for the amount of heavy care patients you’re assigned Time management is borderline impossible unless you skip charting and documenting (which should be caught more often) Just because it’s 7:15 doesn’t mean it’s time for you to clock out and not finish or assist day or night shift with major things you missed

pros: Nurses truly care about the patients. Leadership team is very friendly.
cons: Compensation is based on years experience as RN or leader etc, there is no negotiating salary. Poor communication about raises and bonuses, they do not come on Jan 1 like most other organizations and you are not told if you are getting them at all. Director level is performing managerial tasks. Lack of support under director level, needs managers/assistant directors to do managerial things.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Naples, FL
pros: I’ve worked for NCH for 14 years. I’ve seen lots of change in that time- good and bad.
cons: It’s no longer a small community college. It is corporate at its finest.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Naples, FL
pros: close, small hospital, nice people
cons: they don't value their staff as they should, pay bellow average

pros: This word requirement feels unnecessary
cons: Pay, managers, this word requirement

review_title: Pay is not competitive and management turnover is high
pros: The people you work with
cons: Poor pay, poor management. High turnover and itnis difficult to find affordable housing in Naples

pros: Sign on Bonus and very flexible schedule
cons: There was a contract to stay with the company for 2 years if you accept the sign on bonus. We were always overstaffed. No raises were given. Not a lot of PTO

pros: Self scheduling, not paying for the crappy health insurance
cons: Poor pay, very high turnover. Unsafe for patients. Not enough communication. HR sucks and has random arbitrary policies that they come up with. Nothing better to do I guess.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Naples, FL
pros: Health insurance is free for full time employees. Some managers are great!
cons: Pay is downright horrible. It is frustrating to hear there is a “shortage” of nurses… There’s just a shortage of nurses willing to be paid nothing for a difficult job. It is a highly skilled knowledge set, but pay does not reflect that. I love being a nurse, I give amazing care, I am an asset to this hospital. But I will not last here. Cost of living is high in Naples. Can’t make an actual living on this pay. Can’t afford rent, bills, food without being in a deficit. That’s sad. NCH, it’s time you care about your nurses! And all of your other employees too. It’s not just us. You won’t have a hospital if you lose all your hard working employees.

job_title: IT Service Center Specialist in Naples, FL
pros: Good experience for entry level, good manager
cons: Poor pay, bad hours, HR does not support you. Bad treatment from doctors and clinical staff

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Fort Myers, FL
pros: No more pros anymore to work at NCH
cons: Management has increased nurse to pt ratios. I worked in department that had a lot of nurses that have worked their for awhile and many have jumped ship including the manager.

pros: Good benefits (PTO, health insurance, bonus).
cons: Not much support from higher management (CEO, CFO, president).

pros: Nice starting bonus in first check !!
cons: Learn some Spanish, cuz everyone speaks it

pros: If you want to work in the medical field this allows you to be involved in that environment

review_title: Becoming less of a seasonal city

pros: NCH striving to improve and interested in new ideas from employees.

pros: they have a lot of overtime incentives.
cons: Very understaffed so shifts are always double the workload.

pros: Great employees and benefits overall

pros: Great benefits, great community relations

pros: It is local, depending on the department co-workers are supportive, good benefits

pros: Food is very good here

review_title: Overall an okay company to work for

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Naples, FL
pros: The director and clinical coordinator are great to work for. I always felt like they supported me and were flexible with my schedule and needs. My department was very supportive and kind.
cons: Most individuals outside of the Respiratory Department were very rude, unfriendly, condescending, and difficult to work with. The medical, PTO, and other benefits are very poor. I now work for a health care system that is only 20 miles away from NCH and the benefits package is much better and compensation is much better. I am comparing apples to apples here when comparing my current employer to my former (NCH Healthcare). STEER CLEAR of this hospital system. They are all about the bottom line. I have worked in health care for many years and have worked at several different health care facilities and I have to admit that NCH is by far the worst I have ever worked at. Honestly, I feel bad to give this company a poor rating, but I have to let others know what they could potentially get themselves into when working here and I can't emphasize it enough. DO NOT work for this company. They are all about numbers, numbers, numbers... the bottom line! I hope this helps others because I didn't think to check out other reviews about NCH on glass door! I appreciate being able to inform others about this company.

pros: Great place to work at
cons: no cons i can think of

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Naples, FL

cons: Long hours not enough out for work done

pros: Good team , wonderful manager

pros: The only OK hospital in town.
cons: predatory administrators who use threats and coercion

job_title: Speech Language Pathologist in Naples, FL
pros: Awesome SLP manager and great colleagues. Large system with multiple levels of care from acute  (including two hospitals) to inpatient rehab, LTAC, and several outpatient rehab facilities.  Excellent benefit package that includes programs for employee to improve health and activity level. Good pay for hourly with no benefits. Site-wide effort to become Blue Zone rated.  Clean facilities and well organized. Low caseload during off-season. Excellent program for seasonal employees. Reimbursement for CEUs.
cons: Working in outpatient rehab requires working with adults and peds. Low pay for full-time SLPs who also need benefit package.  Cross trained in all levels of care to support weekend coverage, however pay is not commensurate with high skill level expected. PT earn the most, then OT, then SLP. Salary not inline with high cost of living in Naples, FL.  Very high caseload during season, especially in acute.

review_title: People are friendly and the culture is great. Co workers for the most part are teamwork driven.
pros: The people here are great to work with and it's my only reason why i have not jumped ship yet. Compensation is okay.
cons: Lot of turn over of employees and cost cutting measures that don't make sense. The shortage and turnover of competent core staff will be the demise of the hospital. Patient satisfaction will decline. If you want to grow the company you don't replace the foundation.

review_title: Changing health care creates some difficult changes
pros: Excellent staff to work with both in therapy departments and throughout the hospitals.
cons: Extremely poor office space for therapy staff at North NCH campus.  Apparent lack of respect for extremely competent, necessary and what should be valued staff members.  Lack of space to access computers away from general hospital floors which are becoming more and more dedicated to medical and case management staff.  Therapy "office" with minimal space for computer access and lunch breaks too small to accommodate more than about half of the staff (large bathroom size).

pros: Great people to work with- love the medical field - would rather a walk in clinic vs the hospital - generally more staffing DR in both facilities were for the most part great to work with.
cons:
Long hours, not enough staff especially on the overnight shift and when asking for another person to assist with coverage was told "if I did't like it there is always someone right behind me to take my job and I could quit." Not the kind of response you want to hear from your boss.
  Sometimes you just need extra qualified help to cover the volume of patients and to treat them with care and dignity.

pros: Good co workers, close to the beach
cons: Poor training for new hires/seasonal employees, doesn’t pay enough and staff turn over reflects it, no support for underling staff when it comes to issues with “higher ranking” staff, constantly under staffed in almost every department, no set rules they seem to change depending on who you are talking to and who else was involved, management pretends to listen and then things continue as they were with no changes, health care plan is embarrassingly awful for a health care provider

pros: They have nice family oriented events that are free. They offer discounts to local businesses and theme parks. I'm stumped for more words.
cons: Employee theft of personal items is a huge problem. Management is resistant to changing with the times. High turnover of employees. Disgruntled employees. Not. Great work environment but its a job and it barely pays the bills. I take that back it doesn't pay the bills because they gouge you with the high cost of their medical benefits. I have $8000.00 deductible for me with no spouse and 2 kids. Not to mention the $375 they take from my income per month for medical.

review_title: Been sliding downhill the last 5 years
pros: Some very nice coworkers who are willing to help.  Somewhat flexible scheduling
cons: Ever growing detachment and depersonalization from management.  Employees now feel disposable, hence a very high turnover rate.  The money is low for the cost of living in the area.  The health insurance has high co pays and deductibles.  Not a good long term option.  Lost their route to Magnet status as the nursing staff voted they are not valued .

review_title: Worst job I ever had!!! If you're thinking about it....think again and run like hell!!!!!
pros: Time and a half when you worked a holiday. That's about it
cons:
21 patients for 1 Tech
Unit secretary made $3.00 more an hour than I did, and I had daily patient contact. 
Self scheduling is a joke and non existent.  
Co-workers would hide in empty rooms to avoid helping others. 
Basically treated like utter garbage, and if you complain or voice to management how you feel, you'll get called out for it in front of your peers at the next staff meeting. So, no open door policy what-so-ever.

review_title: So much potential damaged in the past 5 years
pros:
Benefits are ok (used to be better)
Employee and community events
No other ones come to mind at this time
cons:
Pay (low pay, lack of raises)
Benefits declining
Senior management is lost (disconnect from employee base)
Neutral to negative view of system by community
Lack of new technology

pros: This is a great stepping stone in your accounting career. The systems are antiquated and most of the accounting work is manual. I'd recommend any college student fresh out of college to swing through NCH to get their feet wet.
cons: The pay is below par, most positions pay less than a cashier at Costco. NCH will walk through fire for the Doctors ~ Nurses however, will not dump a glass of water on an accountant if they were on fire. In short, the accountants are treated as third class citizens.

pros: Great work environment. Great work ethics. A genuinely client centered culture. You feel that the administration works intently in order to also achieve high scores on nurse satisfaction and retention.
cons: Health insurance is viable only within NCH hospitals and clinics. Some Tier-1 providers who were supposed to be charging you only the co-pay, still billed us for additional pay. Resolution still pending.

review_title: Appears to be a great company. Once you're in, you see what NCH is really like.
job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Naples, FL
pros: The teamwork between the staff is great. The benefits are okay too as long as you're a non smoker. Some managers are excellent, others are a joke.
cons: Administration doesn't care about the "little people". Pay is poor and the administration laughs about it. NCH has a lot of growing to do still. They are a young company and need more experience on how to handle things. I've witnessed them treat physicians poorly too. You have to use PTO for holidays.

job_title: Medical Assistng Phlebotomist in Naples, FL
pros:
Great Hospital, employees, working conditions
Wonderful doctors . Close to home fir any shift needed.  Love this company, insurance and pension .
cons: Corporate rules, really no cons I love this company!!! The only con could be insecure personnel, job security.  As we know everyone is replaceable.  Some people are ore worried then others.

review_title: Lovely place and challenging work but HR policies too tight
job_title: Cash Poster in Arlington Heights, IL
pros: Love the people, location and the work emencely.
cons: I was only there not even a month and I had 3 days off due to illness and BOOM i was no longer wanted because HR policy meant that in the first 30 days no more than 3 days off for ANYTHING.

review_title: Generally a good place to work
pros: Overall a great place to work.  They do value their employees and treat them well.  Every employer has issues and NCH is no different, but they do attempt to make things right.
cons: Salary's are not competitive to the market or geographic area. Bedside nurses are more valued than RN's throughout the rest of the system.

review_title: Decent Place to Work with Good People

pros:
Flexible hours for part-time instructors.
Good team of mid-level managers and great peer network.
Decent environment.
cons:
No benefits or pay increases for instructors.
Reviews are very strange and disjointed.
Not much upper management visibility or contact.
It is a hospital so there are many "rules" but understandable in most cases.
Flu shots are mandatory for all employees.

review_title: Patient Service Rep for NCH Physician Group
job_title: Patient Service Representative in Naples, FL
pros: Cafeteria on site with lots of choices. Training is very thorough. People are super friendly and willing to help. Depending on the management, they are helpful with growth opportunities
cons: Paid holidays comes from your hard earned PTO hours. So for mandatory holidays such as Christmas, you're forced to use 8 hours of your PTO hours.

review_title: Nurses trying their best; without admin support
job_title: RN BSN RN-BC in Naples, FL
pros: Was a Pathways designated hospital, but lost re-designation even with second try.  Was on the Magnet journey.  Not sure anymore.  Beautiful location to live off season.
cons: Unable to meet nurses' basic expectations for renewing Pathways.  High cost of housing and impressive traffic, without compensation compared to other States.

review_title: Beware of the politics!!!!! This is by far my least favorite hospital I have worked at!
job_title: Registered Nurse in Bonita Springs, FL
pros: Great coworkers. They also have a lot of options/ resources available to improve your health. Always a surplus of available overtime.
cons: Poor health insurance benefits, low hourly wages and not comparable to other hospitals and to cost of living.  Policies/rules only apply when it's to the hospitals benefit. Nurses are not appreciated. Everything is punitive. Always receive emails threatening corrective action for various things such as not approving your punch in/out times.

job_title: RN, Bsn in North Naples, FL
pros: Centrally located. Co workers can be nice folks.
cons: Poor senior leadership. An old boys club. They hire fresh new people and then end up ailienating them until they quit. Some areas do not give standard of care and no one really knows or cares.

pros: HR takes forever if you transfer, benefits are decent but could be better for a hospital.
cons: Had the opportunity to transfer 6 months after starting, was eligible for a raise of $1-$2 didn’t get it because my 10 months of experience weren’t counted towards my raise. Was not appreciated in my department, drama that is not corrected from the beginning.

review_title: I am proud to be part of such a wonderful organization - NCH cares about people - I feel lucky to be employed by them.
pros: I enjoy the flexibility, benefits, and the people.
cons: Making change can be slow due to the type of organization but they recognize this.

pros: I loved my coworkers, we were a great team.
cons: Management are like politicians, not to be trusted.

review_title: Great place to work and live
pros: Value all employees input for better patient outcome.  Great equipment and technology. Multiple patient procedure offers. Great place to grow your professional career.
cons: Very disappointed to read other opinions about a place I work at and enjoy.

pros: Its better than working for the alternative hospitals in the area. Still doesnt say much....
cons: Low pay for high cost area. Positions above Management dont care about whats going on with core staff. High turnover rate.

pros: Non for profit helps patients with financial needs to cover medical bills.
cons: Zero merit based recognition. Ultra low compensation. Rude recruiters. Human Resources is a mess and will NEVER defend employees. Management is a Soviet Union style dictatorship.

pros: Generally a pleasant place to work feels like a true nonprofit company.  They always put the patient first.
cons: Human resources could use some work, benefits package seems to keep shrinking as The cost goes up

job_title: Medical and Clinical Laboratory Technologist in North Naples, FL

cons: Not having adequate staff such that work product is not rushed and vulnerable to error.

pros: A lot of caring, professional co-workers, especially the nurses! Mostly very friendly and helpful team players!

review_title: There is a price you'll have to pay to live in this paradise

very seasonal as far as business and job security

pros: Great place to work,  great environment and the people are awesome, you learn a lot and get lots of help and support from co-workers

pros: NCH creates a great morale for their employees. There is great teamwork and the management is right there to help you grow in your career.

pros: Organized, best hospital in the area, good people.

pros: good co-workers in general in the physicians group

review_title: Good company. Cares about the patients.

cons: Has a fairly low salary range for the cost of living.
